intro: Campyloneurum loreum, commonly known as the velvet fern, is a unique plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a soft, velvety appearance. The plant thrives in harsh, dry environments and is adapted to store water in its thick, fleshy leaves. Its growth habit is prostrate, forming a low-growing mat that helps it survive in extreme conditions. Despite its delicate appearance, the velvet fern is resilient and well-suited to its challenging habitat.
